com.nxp.id.jcopx
Class SignatureX

java.lang.Object
  com.nxp.id.jcopx.SignatureX

public final class SignatureX
extends java.lang.Object

SignatureX defines static methods that can be used to generate Java Card objects that implement JCOP specific signature objects. It currently defines the following fields and methods:

Field Summary
static byte ALG_AES_CMAC16
          Signature algorithm ALG_AES_CMAC16 generates an 16-byte MAC using a 2-key DES3 key according to CMAC algorithm NIST SP_800-38B
static byte ALG_DES_CMAC8
          Signature algorithm ALG_DES_CMAC8 generates an 8-byte MAC using a 2-key DES3 key according to CMAC algorithm NIST SP_800-38B
static byte ALG_DES_MAC8_ISO9797_1_M1_ALG3
          Signature algorithm ALG_DES_MAC8_ISO9797_1_M1_ALG3 generates an 8-byte MAC using a 2-key DES3 key according to ISO9797-1 MAC algorithm 3 with method 1 (also EMV'96, EMV'2000), where input data is padded using method 1 and the data is processed as described in MAC Algorithm 3 of the ISO 9797-1 specification.
static byte ALG_ECDSA_PLAIN
          Signature algorithm signs/verifies the message without hashing using ECDSA.
static byte ALG_KOREAN_SEED_MAC_FPAD
          Signature algorithm ALG_KOREAN_SEED_MAC_NOPAD generates an 16-byte MAC using Korean SEED in CBC mode.
static byte ALG_KOREAN_SEED_MAC_NRPAD
          Signature algorithm ALG_KOREAN_SEED_MAC_NRPAD generates an 16-byte MAC using Korean SEED in CBC mode.
static byte ALG_RSA_SHA_256_ISO9796
          Signature algorithm ALG_RSA_SHA_256_ISO9796 generates a 32-byte SHA digest, pads the digest according to the ISO 9796-2 scheme as specified in EMV '96 and EMV 2000, and encrypts it using RSA.
 
Method Summary

          Creates a Signature object instance of the selected algorithm.

Field Detail

ALG_KOREAN_SEED_MAC_NRPAD

public static final byte ALG_KOREAN_SEED_MAC_NRPAD
Signature algorithm ALG_KOREAN_SEED_MAC_NRPAD generates an 16-byte MAC using Korean SEED in CBC mode.

Note:

  • This algorithm must not be implemented if export restrictions apply.

See Also:

Signature algorithm ALG_KOREAN_SEED_MAC_NOPAD generates an 16-byte MAC using Korean SEED in CBC mode.

Note:

  • This algorithm must not be implemented if export restrictions apply.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ALG_ECDSA_PLAIN

public static final byte ALG_ECDSA_PLAIN
Signature algorithm signs/verifies the message without hashing using ECDSA. The signature is encoded as an ASN.1 sequence of two INTEGER values, r and s, in that order: SEQUENCE ::= { r INTEGER, s INTEGER }

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ALG_DES_MAC8_ISO9797_1_M1_ALG3

public static final byte ALG_DES_MAC8_ISO9797_1_M1_ALG3
Signature algorithm ALG_DES_MAC8_ISO9797_1_M1_ALG3 generates an 8-byte MAC using a 2-key DES3 key according to ISO9797-1 MAC algorithm 3 with method 1 (also EMV'96, EMV'2000), where input data is padded using method 1 and the data is processed as described in MAC Algorithm 3 of the ISO 9797-1 specification. The left key block of the triple DES key is used as a single DES key(K) and the right key block of the triple DES key is used as a single DES Key (K') during MAC processing. The final result is truncated to 8 bytes as described in ISO9797-1.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ALG_DES_CMAC8

public static final byte ALG_DES_CMAC8
Signature algorithm ALG_DES_CMAC8 generates an 8-byte MAC using a 2-key DES3 key according to CMAC algorithm NIST SP_800-38B

ALG_RSA_SHA_256_ISO9796

public static final byte ALG_RSA_SHA_256_ISO9796
Signature algorithm ALG_RSA_SHA_256_ISO9796 generates a 32-byte SHA digest, pads the digest according to the ISO 9796-2 scheme as specified in EMV '96 and EMV 2000, and encrypts it using RSA.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getInstance

public static javacard.security.Signature getInstance(byte algorithm,
                                                      boolean externalAccess)
Creates a Signature object instance of the selected algorithm.

Parameters:
algorithm - the desired Signature algorithm. Valid codes listed in ALG_ .. constants above e.g. ALG_DES_MAC8_ISO9797_1_M1_ALG3
externalAccess - true indicates that the instance will be shared among multiple applet instances and that the Signature instance will also be accessed (via a Shareable interface) when the owner of the Signature instance is not the currently selected applet.
Returns:
the Signature object instance of the requested algorithm
Throws:
CryptoException - with the following reason codes:
  • CryptoException.NO_SUCH_ALGORITHM if the requested algorithm or shared access mode is not supported.
